_description: Erotic rhyme of lover addressing his past love — one 7-line stanza

CULFf238.Transcription:
Adewe my prettye pusseyThus youe pynce my eareyoure sodayne
                    passynge thus from mechangethe muchh my chearThinke you this to pas
                    meA beter yrond shal yrasp yevntel another yere
CULFf238.Note: Added to lower margin by a hand of the sixteenth century.
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
